title: 4313.0101 Accounts Executive (Statutory
description: Accounts Clerk/Accounts Executive Compliance) is a person responsible for accumulating data required for (Payroll) computation of tax liabilities namely Service Tax, TDS and VAT. The Accounts Clerk keeps day to day accounts responsibilities include ascertaining tax for financial transactions and maintains liabilities, making approved and various book-registers and records authorized payment to the Government relating to them. Receives bills, vouchers within the applicable time frame, filing of and other documents concerning respective returns to the concerned purchases, sale or articles etc. and checks authority by the due date and maintaining accuracy. Prepares pay and allowances records of the same for future bills of staff for encashment and other reference/audit purpose. sundry statements for records. May operate calculating machine. May type letters, statements, Group 432 etc. May handle cash in office or Material Recording and Transport institution. May perform duties of Ledger Clerks Clerk or Bookkeeper. Code 5414 Searches persons, vehicles and checks Title Security Guards goods at exit for contraband articles, where required. Collects passes or tokens

description: issued to visitor and forwards them to Watchman concerned authority at end of his duty. Reports unauthorized entry and Watchman; Chowkidar guard buildings, suspicious occurrences to superior premises, industrial plants, ware-houses, officers. May detain unauthorized persons railway goods-sheds and yards etc. against and inform his superior or police. May fire, theft, illegal entry and other such maintain visitors book at entrance and contingencies. Receives instructions about VOLUME II A 572
